comment: Amazing professor and very caring. He truly wants the best for every student with leaving nobody behind who try their best. Will have about 5 papers to write , he'll explain clearly what needs to be done and the textbook helps a lot ( get the textbook). You will write a lot but it's reasonable in becoming a better writer. You'll enjoy his class
Lots of writing but besides that the class is quite enjoyable. Overall as long as you come to class and follow instructions on how to write your papers you're looking at a an A.

I took TCOM2010 and it was a cakewalk. You do not need the textbook, I never used it and popped an A on every paper. His class are his lectures (which are long and boring), but the class is overall easy A. You have about 4-5 papers (which range from 1-2 pages each), a PPT presentation as the final, and attendance is a grade. Great grade booster.

I took this class in the summer and it was a reasonable amount of workload. I ended making an A in this class by just following his guidelines on his assignments and you will pass. I am not a strong writer, but I just following his rubrics and you will do just fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Work load was impossiblbly heavy for the summer.  Discussions multiple times during the week.  Tough grader too.  You will be writing your entire summer, daily.  Don't take over the summer.  you will regret it.

Took it online in the summer. I would highly recommend doing this! Dr. Hopper is pretty funny and gives very clear instructions for the discussion boards. He had to clarify a few things for the last two writing assignments, but that is to be expected in an online writing class.

He is very funny and all of the assignments are good for learning. If you need help you can email him and he is very good about responding. Can come across as a bit arrogant at times, but he's achieved a lot and is very smart so it makes sense. No tests, just discussions and assignments. I would recommend him for tech writing for sure.

Professor Hopper is one of those rare professors that not only enjoys what he does, he goes out of his way to help you enjoy the class as well.  This class is well structured, easy to follow, and not over burdensome in regards to workload.  You WILL get very valuable tools out of this class. Take him.  A+ Professor

Dr. Hopper gives you a lot of room to explore areas of interest as they relate to the course subject matter. And he's funny as hell. I learned without realizing I was learning - and he worked with me when I had some scheduling issues. You won't be disappointed taking a class from Dr. Hopper.

Professor Hopper changed how I view online classes. His class was flexible, he provided very detailed feedback, and I never felt as though I was wasting my time. Enjoyable class, not very difficult, and the teacher really puts effort in to it! Very good online course

Took him in summer of 2011. I had the hybrid course where we met once a week. There was an assignment due every week, but didnt take very long and was very straightforward. Useful and easy class, cool guy. Put a little(note:little) humor in your writing, he'll appreciate it. Not a very interesting lecture, but still worth going to class once a week
Great instructor. Has a good sense of humor and easy to work with. Learned alot.

This class was hybrid. I liked the format where we met one week in class and one week online. There is a lot of work in this course but it is interesting and it will benefit later. Teacher is very helpful and teacher well. Recommended. class is boring but u can sign in and leave.

This class was hybrid. I liked the format where we met one week in class and one week online. There is work in this course but it is interesting and it will benefit later. Teacher is very helpful and teacher well. Recommended

Very easy teacher and he knows technical writing well.  The only thing I didnt like was the writing partners thing.  I would recommend him though.  I took him online and still felt that I learned a lot.
Good instructor. Has a sense of humor (most important!), listens to questions and comments. Encourages participation and discussion.
